ovdesc.p: The collateral right file is used to record the status of a right of security and to indicate against which customer outstandings the right applies.
The link between the collateral right and the collateral object itself is implicit in the item-id structure between the two files.
The limit reference field on the collateral right record is used to identify which contract(s) the collateral is valid against.
This link between the collateral and the outstanding debit balances belonging to the customer may be made at one of three levels as follows:
contract/account level: the collateral is valid only against a given contract or set of contracts.
limit level: the collateral is valid against all contracts currently recorded under a particular limit reference and against any contracts which subsequently come under that limit.
customer level: the collateral is valid against any debit balance which exists or arises on the customer's accounts or contracts with the bank.
The latter case is implied by leaving the limit reference field blank on the collateral right record. Otherwise, the appropriate limits or contract references should be entered.

It is important to note that, if collateral values are being used in a process of reallocating debit balances across general ledger (or central bank) reporting lines, the level at which this link is made affects the priority with which debit balances are considered for reallocation. If a mixture of these levels is in use, all contract/account level balances will be considered first by the system, followed by limit-level balances and finally, any remaining balances attributable at customer-level will be considered.

desc.p: Notes.
Up to 35 characters free text. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
The status of the collateral right.
The status of the collateral right is indicated in this field as follows:
FWD - forward status; validity date is forward;
CUR - current status; expiry date is forward & validity date is not;
LIQ - liquidated status; expiry date is past;
MAT - matured status; record occurs only on history file.
The only status under which a collateral right is considered by the system's reallocation process is current.

In most cases, the status indicated against the collateral right will also be indicated against any collateral objects belonging to the right. The sole exception is when a collateral object has an earlier expiry date than its corresponding right (in which case the object is considered expired whilst the right remains current).
This field is automatically maintained by the system by an end-of-day process and is updated in accordance with any changes to the dates entered on-line.
'FWD', 'CUR', 'LIQ' or 'MAT'.
Internal field. This is a NOINPUT field.
The item-id's of any limit records which are linked to the collateral right.

This field, which is automatically maintained by the system, contains a list of item-id's to the limit file. This list indicates records against which the value of the collateral may be allocated by the system. The list is derived from the content of LIMIT.REFERENCE. It contains only those limits which are marked as 'secured' and which belong to a limit line indicated by one or more of the foregoing references.

Up to 24-character limit id (1 to 6-digit liability (customer) number; period; 7-digit limit reference number; period; 2-digit limit serial number; (optional) period; (optional) 1 to 6-digit customer number). Multivalue field.
Internal field. This is a NOINPUT field.
Item-id to record on customer file.
For information purposes only. For example, this field may be used to record a customer, other than that mentioned in the item-id, supplying the collateral.
1-10 digit numeric (customer id). Multivalue field. (Optional input)
Values may not be duplicated.
The expiry date of the collateral right.

For certain types of collateral, the values attached to the collateral may only be valid for a limited period. This field may be used to record, in advance, the expiry date associated with the collateral.
Although this is mainly for reporting and management purposes, the presence of a date in this field also blocks the reallocation process for the collateral values (after such date has passed).
A past date in this field always indicates a status of 'liquidated', both on the collateral right itself and on any associated collateral objects.
11 type D (date format). (Optional input)
The date may not be earlier than the VALIDITY.DATE.
A customer id which may be used to reference details of the public notary.
Details of the public notary are recorded on a customer record, which is indicated in this field.
1-10 digit numeric (customer id). (Optional input)
The percentage of cover which applies to the collateral.
The percentage of cover belonging to a collateral right is calculated by the formula:
% of cover = 100 x debit balance / value
where:
debit balance = (sum of) debit balance(s) under the limit reference (or contract id) belonging to the collateral right.
value = (sum of) net execution value(s) belonging to collateral objects attached to the right,
net execution value = execution value - third party value.
Note that, for the purposes of this calculation, the system always assumes that the entire value of a given entity belongs exclusively to the right under which it occurs.
The percentage of cover may initially be entered by the user and subsequently updated periodically by the system according to a frequency determined per collateral code.
This field may take the value zero (=0%) or null (=unknown or not applicable) or greater than 100%.
The system-calculated value is available as an on-line default (when attached collateral values have been authorized), but will not override any user-input.
The value in this field is for information only, and has no subsequent impact on the system's reallocation process (ie. in determining whether a given level of excess value exists).
Note : If the system's calculation of this value yields an invalid result, the value 999 will be returned.
1 to 3-digit numeric. (Optional input)
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Reserved for future use.
The review date & frequency which is to apply to the collateral right.
The date of the next review combined with the frequency of review.
A default frequency may be defined on the collateral code file. If so, the value of this field defaults to one cycle forward from today's date according to this default frequency.
The date part of this field is automatically cycled by the system.
17 type frequency format. (Optional input; default, if applicable, according to the collateral code)
The date upon which the collateral right becomes effective.
This date corresponds to the date on which the right of security becomes legal.
A forward date may be entered, in which case no reallocation of the attached collateral values will take place (the status of the record is treated as 'forward').
11 type D characters.
Mandatory input; default is today's date.
If a percentage value is entered then Collateral can be allocated to a limit at any level i.e. product, sub product or below sub product level.
If no value is entered then collateral will be allocated at the top level of the limit structure for the limit defined in the associated LIMIT.REFERENCE field.

If a percentage value is entered then that percentage of the execution value of the relevant collateral item will be allocated to the SECURED.AMT of the limit record defined in the associated LIMIT.REFERENCE field.
Collateral execution value = 8m.
Limit1 then limit2 are defined in the LIMIT.REFERENCE field.
Limit 1 defined as MAXIMUM.SECURED of 8m on limit record.
Limit 2 defined as MAXIMUM.SECURED of 8m on limit record.
Limit 2 is utilised by a transaction of 5m, which results in a SECURED.AMT of 5m.
Limit 1 is then utilised by a transaction of 5m, which results in a SECURED.AMT of 3m, the remainder of the collateral.
Then the batch processing takes place.
The limits will be modified so that limit 1 (the first limit defined on COLLATERAL.RIGHT) will have a SECURED.AMT of 5m while limit 2 now has a secured amount of 3m, (the remainder).
The limit structure is as follows.
Limit 100 is at product level.
Limit 101 is at sub product level.
Limit 102 is at sub product level
Limit 103 is at sub product level
Collateral with an execution value of 8m is assigned as follows via LIMIT.REFERENCE and PERCENT.ALLOC
75% to limit 101.
25% to limit 102.
In this case all of the collateral is assigned to the limit structure 100.
The secured amount, which will be allocated to limit 101, is 6m (75% of the execution value of 8m) and 2m for limit 102 (25% of the collateral execution value).
If limit 101 is utilised for more than 6m and limit 102 is not used then the secured amount for 101 will still be 6m.
If a transaction takes place which impacts limit 103 then the secured amount will be zero, as the limit has not been defined on COLLATERAL.RIGHT.
Optional input, up to 3 numeric characters. If a value is entered then the sum of all the PERCENT.ALLOC fields must equal 100. Multi valued field in the association beginning at COMPANY
Specifies the customer of the contract in the LIMIT.REFERENCE field or the customer number to be covered when no LIMIT.REFERENCE is defined.

A collateral right record is created using the customer number of the provider of collateral. A particular collateral right may cover an entire customer’s risk, or particular contracts / limits. The customer being covered may be the customer or another customer. This field indicates the beneficiary of the contract / limit covered, or if no specific contracts are to be covered it can be used to indicate the beneficiary of the collateral.
The value is defaulted when a contract is entered, and can be entered when no contracts are specified.
Optional Input
Must be the Customer of the associated LIMIT.REFERENCE if defined.
Must be a valid CUSTOMER number
The account, contract id or limit reference against which the collateral right is valid.
This field is used to link the collateral at deal or limit level. If left blank, it is assumed by the system that the collateral is valid against all outstandings of the customer.
Valid input is any contract, account number or limit idas follows:
account number; the account number from the account file (mnemonic not accepted)
foreign exchange transaction reference
letter of credit transaction reference
loans (& deposits) contract number
MD.DEAL contract number
mortgage contract number,
money market contract number
limit ; actual id of the actual limit record.
More than one of the above references may be entered and the references need not all belong to the same application.
In each case, the reference given should belong to the customer mentioned in the item-id to the collateral right record. If this is not the case, an override condition must be accepted.
Note that any link to multiple transactions may be made by the use of a product-level limit and that, similarly, a link to multiple limits may be made by the use of a global limit reference.
Multivalue field in association with COMPANY field.
Note : A mixture of limit and contract/account references is permitted.
Up to 32 alphanumeric characters; exact format determined by the application to which the reference belongs. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
Limit reference can be specified with Main group limits. Sub group limits are not allowed.
Local reference field.
Defined by local table. Multivalue field. (Optional input)
This is a work field used by the system to maintain a temporary pointer to a work record used in the allocation of collateral. It has no direct business use.
System-maintained
Code of the category to which the collateral right belongs.
The content of this field must be a valid code defined on the collateral code file.
1-3 digit numeric. (Mandatory input)
Unique identification of collateral right. This item-id consists of the customer id followed by a sequence number. The two are separated by a period (full stop).
The item-id by which the collateral right is identified.
The item-id to the collateral right file is made up of two components, separated by a period (full stop).

The first component is the customer id. This is the customer against whose outstandings the collateral is held. All subsequently mentioned accounts, limits or transaction references must belong to this customer (exception=override condition).
This first component must be a valid customer id defined on the customer file.
The second component identifies, where required, further rights of security given by the customer. The default value of this sequence number is one.

When the customer number has been entered by the user, the system will automatically append the default sequence number of '.1'. The user may subsequently enter only the second (suffix) part of the item-id to bring up further records belonging to that customer.
This item-id also forms the first two components of the item-id to records on the collateral main file.
1-10 digit numeric (customer id), period, 1 to 4-digit numeric (sequence number).
The sequence number following the full stop may not be zero.
The company in which the LIMIT.REFERENCE record exists.
This field is intended for use in multi-company environments only. It indicates the company to which any contract id or limit reference given in the next field belongs.
Input must be a valid company mnemonic defined on the company file.
The field is defaulted in a single-company environment to the value of the company mnemonic in use.
In a multi-company environment, the default value is determined by the appropriate field on the (signed-on) company record according to the content of the corresponding LIMIT.REFERENCE.
Multivalue field associated with LIMIT.REFERENCE.
